title: What is the degree course after a BSc in general? - Quora

response.answer_text: Degree courses after B. Sc. graduation: M. Sc. or Master of Science: M. Sc. is the most obvious and logical choice for B. Sc graduates when it comes to higher studies. Master degree in a specialized subject can open a lot of door for doctorate, research and excellent employment opportunities for students. MBA or Master of Business Administrations: This is one of the most sought after career choice for graduates of every stream, and B. Sc graduates are not an exception to this rule. Many institutes have started offering MBA degrees with specialization in scientific domains like hospital management, laboratory management and IT management that are ideal for B. Sc graduates. MBA gives you the confidence to pursue your dreams and gives you a force to innovate and experiment. A management degree polishes your managerial skills making you to work towards the goal of the application with greater productivity and lesser cost. The course makes you acquainted with all the aspects of running a company. It grooms the person to serve the best to oneself – only then can he be an asset to an organization. MCA or Master of Computer Application: With the IT boom dominating Indian economy, computer applications and IT industry has emerged as one of the most lucrative career options available to B. Sc degree holders. For students who want to pursue their higher studies in this domain, MCA is an ideal academic programme. B.Ed or Bachelor of Education: For B. Sc graduates, who have the potential to be expert teachers, B.Ed degree would be an excellent choice of further studies. B.Ed degree coaches the students into different and unique pedagogy techniques that aid them in improving their teaching prowess even further. List of few colleges that offer these courses: Lovely Professional University, JalandharCochin University of Science and Technology, KochiAmrita School of Engineering, CoimbatoreBirla Institute of Technology and Science, PilaniMotilal Nehru National Institute of Technology AllahabadRamaiah Institute of Technology, BangaloreBharati Vidyapeeth Deemed University College of Engineering, Pune

After a Bsc there are huge no of courses . Well done , if you have completed your graduation with a Bsc degree . Because your career is now open to grasp huge no. of opportunities . I'm suggesting here few professional courses , that are very useful in today's world to get a good job . Masters in computer application from NITs : MCA is a very good course to study , if you pursue it from premium government college . Try to get a chance in NITs or government engineering or science universities .Masters in travel & tourism management : I have already answered about the course in my previous answers . The potential of the course is very high as hospitality industry is becoming one of the greatest course .Masters in social work (MSW) : Many students think MSW is a course only for arts background student . But it is wrong . If you have interest in the field of rural development , hygiene work , administration , social working , you can pursue the course .Thanks .
